title: Drawing, "Design for an Oval Frame on Theme of  Venus Victorious", 1690–1700
medium: Pen and black ink,  graphite on paper
markings: Watermark: inside oval, I, Uppercase cursive J, a fleur de lys, and a C.
provenance: Hippolyte Destailleur (sale Paris, May 19, 1896, no. 469); Léon Decloux, Sèvres, France, acquired by him after 1906.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Oval frame showing in top center an escutcheon with Venus head and her girdle. Lambrequins hang at the bottom, the central one shows a pair of doves on globe under a star. A pair of torches. At left rises a bough of myrtle.  Much of the decoration of the right half is not shown. Inscribed in frame, in graphite, upper left: VICTRIX; upper center: VENUS VICTRIX; in pen and brown ink, top center:  Venus Victrix; upper right:  a ceinture de Ven(us)/ et ses attributs, at left edge: ...rithe (?); verso: dotted oval.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for an Oval Frame on Theme of  Venus Victorious", 1690–1700.
1690–1700. Pen and black ink,  graphite on paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-240.
